statement_context: an interview with the New York Times
ruling_headline: Donald Trump weighs in on China's island-building in the South China Sea
statement: China is "in the South China Sea and (building) a military fortress the likes of which perhaps the world has not seen."

statement_context: an interview with the New York Times
ruling_headline: Donald Trump says China's economic growth is thanks to the United States
statement: "We’ve rebuilt China."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump has no evidence that Ted Cruz was responsible for naked Melania ad
statement: Says Ted Cruz distributed the ad showing a nude Melania Trump on a rug.

ruling_headline: Donald Trump: Michelle Fields changed her story since first claiming campaign manager grabbed her
statement: Says that when Michelle Fields "found out that there was a security camera, and that they had her on tape, all of a sudden that story changed."

statement_context: an interview with the New York Times
ruling_headline: Trump miscasts impact on trade of Chinese taxes
statement: "There’s a tremendous tax that we pay when we (American businesses) go into China, whereas when China sells to us there’s no tax."

statement_context: a speech at the 2016 American Israel Public Affairs Committee conference in Washington.
ruling_headline: Donald Trump says Iran military will have nuclear weapons as soon as enrichment limits expire
statement: "When those restrictions expire (in the Iran nuclear deal), Iran will have an industrial-size military nuclear capability ready to go."

statement_context: a speech to the American Israel Public Affairs Committee
ruling_headline: Donald Trump says Iran is responsible for terrorist attacks in 25 countries, five continents
statement: "During the last five years, Iran has perpetrated terror attacks in 25 different countries on five continents."

ruling_headline: Club for Growth claim ignores key points of Donald Trump's stand on healthcare coverage
statement: Says Donald Trump promised "to take care of everybody (through government-run healthcare and) the government's going to pay for it."

statement_context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: John Kasich calls out Donald Trump's '$1.8 billion worth of free media'
statement: Says Donald "Trump got, you know, $1.8 billion worth of free media. I got, like, none."

ruling_headline: No, Donald Trump, we are not giving Iran $150 billion for 'nothing'
statement: Under the Iran nuclear deal, "we give them $150 billion, we get nothing."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump wrongly links Ohio campaign event protester to ISIS
statement: Says the man who rushed the stage at him in Dayton, Ohio, "had chatter about ISIS, or with ISIS" in his social media posts.

ruling_headline: No, GDP growth was not zero, as Donald Trump said in Miami GOP debate
statement: "GDP was zero essentially for the last two quarters."

ruling_headline: Common Core is 'education through Washington, D.C.,' Trump says
statement: Common Core is "education through Washington D.C."

ruling_headline: Pro-Ted Cruz PAC wrongly says Donald Trump wants government-run health care
statement: Says Donald Trump said the government is going to pay for everybody to have health care.

statement_context: a Democratic presidential debate in Flint, Mich.
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says he consistently beats Donald Trump by bigger margins than Hillary Clinton does
statement: "Almost every poll has shown that Sanders vs. Trump does a lot better than Clinton vs. Trump … and, that’s true nationally."

statement_context: remarks after the Super Tuesday balloting
ruling_headline: Is Donald Trump right that the Great Wall of China is 2,000 years old and 13,000 miles long?
statement: "The Great Wall of China, built 2,000 years ago, is 13,000 miles (long)."

statement_context: an interview with NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: Mitt Romney praised Donald Trump's business skill in 2012, then flip-flopped in 2016
statement: On Donald Trump's track record in business

statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Detroit
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says Donald Trump wrote 10 checks to Hillary Clinton campaigns
statement: Says Donald Trump has written 10 checks to Hillary Clinton "and four of those checks were not to her Senate campaign. … It was to her presidential campaign."

statement_context: a GOP debate hosted by Fox
ruling_headline: Donald Trump resurrects debunked claim that wives of 9/11 hijackers fled the U.S. days before attack
statement: The wives of the 9/11 hijackers "knew exactly what was happening" and went back to Saudi Arabia two days before the attacks to watch their husbands on television flying the planes.

statement_context: a GOP debate hosted by Fox
ruling_headline: Donald Trump is right: Marco Rubio has worst Senate voting record
statement: Marco Rubio "has the No. 1 absentee record in the United States" Senate.

statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Detroit
ruling_headline: John Kasich correct that he polls best among GOP hopefuls against Hillary Clinton
statement: In head-to-head polls for the general election, "I beat Hillary Clinton by more than anybody, by 11 points."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump falls for phony Gandhi quote: 'First they ignore you, then they laugh at you ... '
statement: Says Mahatma Gandhi once said, "First they ignore you, then they laugh at you, then they fight you, then you win."

statement_context: comments on CNN's State of the Union
ruling_headline: Donald Trump's absurd claim that he knows nothing about former KKK leader David Duke
statement: "I don't know anything about David Duke."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz wrongly says Harry Reid likes Donald Trump best in GOP field
statement: Says "Harry Reid, when asked about the Republican field, said the Republican he likes the best is Donald Trump, and he said, because I can work with him. He'll cut deals."

ruling_headline: Yes, Donald Trump has been linked to the mob
statement: "There have been multiple media reports about (Donald Trump's) business dealings with the mob, with the mafia."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump wrong that New York Times can't be sued for a 'story that they know is false'
statement: Says "the New York Times can write a story that they know is false" yet "they can't basically be sued."

ruling_headline: Fact-checking Donald Trump's claims about Trump University
statement: "We (Trump University) have an ‘A’ from the Better Business Bureau."

statement_context: the GOP primary debate in Texas
ruling_headline: We Googled 'Trump Polish workers.' Here's what we found
statement: Says Donald Trump hired illegal workers "from Poland and he had to pay a million dollars or so in a judgment."

statement_context: comments during the Houston GOP debate
ruling_headline: Donald Trump's Pants on Fire claim he never discussed Libya intervention
statement: Says Ted Cruz "said I was in favor in Libya. I never discussed that subject."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump wrongly claims he started immigration debate
statement: "If it weren’t for me … (illegal immigration) wouldn’t even be a big subject."

statement_context: a rally in North Charleston, S.C.
ruling_headline: Donald Trump cites dubious legend about Gen. Pershing, pig's blood and Muslims
statement: Says that in the Philippines more than a century ago, Gen. John Pershing "took 50 bullets, and he dipped them in pigs’ blood," and shot 49 Muslim rebels. "The 50th person, he said, ‘You go back to your people, and you tell them what happened.’ And for 25 years, there wasn’t a problem."

ruling_headline: Trump wrongly says Obamacare has 'no options,' competitive bidding
statement: With Obamacare, "You have no options .. you can't get competitive bidding."

ruling_headline: Do Republicans think Donald Trump is the right candidate to beat Hillary Clinton?
statement: "About 70 percent of Republicans nationwide ... don't think Donald Trump is the right guy" to take on Hillary Clinton in November.

ruling_headline: Donald Trump was not 'loud and clear' in Iraq War opposition
statement: On the Iraq war, "I said it loud and clear, 'You'll destabilize the Middle East.' "

statement_context: a victory speech after the New Hampshire primary
ruling_headline: Donald Trump repeats Pants on Fire claim that unemployment rate could be 42 percent
statement: "Don't believe those phony numbers when you hear 4.9 and 5 percent unemployment. The number's probably 28, 29, as high as 35. In fact, I even heard recently 42 percent."

ruling_headline: Is Donald Trump self-funding his campaign? Sort of
statement: "I'm self-funding my own campaign."

statement_context: an ABC Republican debate in New Hampshire
ruling_headline: Donald Trump calls U.S. 'the highest taxed country in the world'
statement: "Right now we’re the highest taxed country in the world."

statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Manchester, N.H.
ruling_headline: Donald Trump overstates his early opposition to the Iraq War
statement: Regarding the Iraq War, "I was the one that said, ‘Don’t go, don’t do it, you’re going to destabilize the Middle East.’ "

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz's false claim that Trump, Clinton and Sanders 'have the identical position on health care'
statement: "Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders have the identical position on health care, which is they want to put the government in charge of you and your doctor."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump falsely claims he 'never once asked' for Megyn Kelly's removal from debate
statement: "I never once asked that (Megyn Kelly) be removed" as a debate moderator.

statement_context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: Donald Trump calls out Ted Cruz ad about Trump bulldozing a widow's home as 'false advertising'
statement: Says a Ted Cruz ad has "got me bull-dozing down a house. I never bulldozed it down. It's false advertising."

statement_context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: What Donald Trump said about the Chinese inventing the 'hoax' of climate change
statement: Says Donald Trump "thinks that climate change is a hoax, invented by the Chinese."

statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in North Charleston, S.C.
ruling_headline: Donald Trump exaggerates when he says China has 'total control' over North Korea
statement: China has "total control, just about, of North Korea."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump's false claim that refugees, migrants are mostly 'strong, powerful men'
statement: Among Syrian refugees and migrants coming into Europe, "there look like very few women. Very few children."

statement_context: an interview with NBC's "Meet the Press" in Ottumwa, Iowa
ruling_headline: Donald Trump mostly wrong that 'we get practically nothing' from South Korea for U.S. troop presence
statement: "We get practically nothing compared to the cost of" keeping U.S. military forces in South Korea.

statement_context: Ottumwa, Iowa, on NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: Donald Trump repeats wrong claim that prisoners swapped for Bergdahl are 'back on the battlefield'
statement: The five Guantanamo detainees swapped for Bowe Bergdahl are "back on the battlefield."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump's first TV ad shows migrants 'at the southern border,' but they're actually in Morocco
statement: A Trump television ad shows Mexicans swarming over "our southern border."

statement_context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: Donald Trump is right about Putin's popularity in Russia
statement: Says American polling shows Russian President Vladimir Putin has "an 80 percent approval rating."

ruling_headline: No evidence for Hillary Clinton's claim that ISIS is using videos of Donald Trump as recruiting tool
statement: ISIS is "going to people showing videos of Donald Trump insulting Islam and Muslims in order to recruit more radical jihadists."

statement_context: the Republican debate in Las Vegas
ruling_headline: Trump repeats tale of flights home of 9/11 hijackers' wives, girlfriends, families
statement: The 9/11 terrorists' friends, family, girlfriends in the United States "were sent back for the most part to Saudi Arabia. They knew what was going on. They went home, and they wanted to watch their boyfriends on television."

statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Las Vegas
ruling_headline: Geneva Conventions bar Donald Trump's idea of killing terrorists' families, as Rand Paul says
statement: "If you are going to kill the families of terrorists, realize that there's something called the Geneva Convention we're going to have to pull out of."

ruling_headline: Jeb Bush largely right in CNN debate that Donald Trump said 'ISIS was not our fight' 2 months ago
statement: "Two months ago, Donald Trump said that ISIS was not our fight."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump exaggerates how much coal in U.S. has been phased out
statement: "We're practically not allowed to use coal any more. What do we do with our coal? We ship it to China and they spew it in the air."

ruling_headline: Trump cites shaky survey in call to ban Muslims from entering US
statement: Says 25 percent of U.S. Muslims "agreed that violence against Americans here in the United States is justified as a part of the global jihad."

ruling_headline: Trump's Pants on Fire tweet that blacks killed 81% of white homicide victims
statement: Says crime statistics show blacks kill 81 percent of white homicide victims.

ruling_headline: Fact-checking Trump's claim that thousands in New Jersey cheered when World Trade Center tumbled
statement: "I watched in Jersey City, N.J., where thousands and thousands of people were cheering" as the World Trade Center collapsed.

ruling_headline: Trump says NYPD used to spy on mosques
statement: The New York Police Department used to have "surveillance going on in and around mosques in New York City. ... Our mayor totally cut that out."

statement_context: an interview on Laura Ingraham's radio show
ruling_headline: Donald Trump says Obama administration is pushing refugees toward states with GOP governors
statement: The federal government is sending refugees to states with governors who are "Republicans, not to the Democrats."

ruling_headline: Trump says China gets an advantage from the Trans-Pacific Partnership
statement: The Trans-Pacific Partnership "was designed for China to come in, as they always do, through the back door and totally take advantage of everyone."

ruling_headline: Trump: Eisenhower deported 1.5 million immigrants
statement: Says President Dwight Eisenhower "moved 1.5 million illegal immigrants out of this country."

ruling_headline: Trump says that trade imbalance between U.S. and China tops $500B
statement: "We’re losing now over $500 billion a year in terms of imbalance with China."

ruling_headline: Trump: 'My numbers on leadership, it’s two or three or four times higher than anybody else'
statement: Says that in polls about 2016 candidate leadership skills, he comes out "two and three and four times higher than anybody else."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump's false claim that his tax plan wouldn't increase the deficit
statement: Says his plan would cut taxes without increasing the deficit.

ruling_headline: Donald Trump vs. John Harwood on length of CNBC debate
statement: The CNBC debate was supposed to be three hours, and he "renegotiated it down to two hours."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump's fracked-up claim on shale's economic impact in Ohio
statement: Says Ohio Gov. John Kasich "got lucky with a thing called fracking," which "is why Ohio is doing well."

statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Boulder, Colo.
ruling_headline: Donald Trump didn't realize his own website called Marco Rubio 'Mark Zuckerberg's personal senator'
statement: "I never said that" Marco Rubio was Mark Zuckerberg’s personal senator.

ruling_headline: Trump: Obamacare health care premiums 'going up 35, 45, 55 percent'
statement: Because of Obamacare "people’s premiums ... are going up 35, 45, 55 percent."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says CIA warned George W. Bush of Sept. 11 attacks
statement: Says CIA Director George Tenet told the Bush administration that the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attack "was coming. So they did have advanced notice."

ruling_headline: Trump supports eminent domain 'abuse,' says conservative Club for Growth
statement: Says Donald Trump "supports eminent domain" and the Supreme Court’s Kelo decision.

ruling_headline: Donald Trump: Syrian refugees potentially headed to U.S. are mostly men
statement: Among Syrian refugees, "there aren't that many women, there aren't that many children."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says the unemployment rate may be 42 percent
statement: The unemployment rate may be as high as "42 percent."

ruling_headline: Did Hillary Clinton start the Obama birther movement?
statement: "The birther movement was started by Hillary Clinton in 2008. She was all in!"

ruling_headline: Fact-checking Donald Trump's attack on Carly Fiorina's record at Hewlett-Packard
statement: When Carly Fiorina says Hewlett-Packard "revenues went up, that's because she bought Compaq. It was a terrible deal."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says Marco Rubio has 'worst voting record there is today'
statement: Says Marco Rubio has "the worst voting record there is today."

statement_context: a GOP presidential debate on CNN
ruling_headline: Donald Trump says Mexico doesn't have birthright citizenship
statement: Says Mexico doesn't have birthright citizenship, and Americans are the "only ones" to have it.

ruling_headline: Trump: Walker turned a $1 billion surplus into a $2.2 budget shortfall
statement: Says Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker turned a $1 billion surplus into a $2.2 billion budget deficit.

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says Yale Law's 'top man' criticized former HP CEO Carly Fiorina
statement: "The top man at Yale Law School came out ... with just a raging report" about former HP CEO Carly Fiorina, saying she is "one of the worst executives in his memory in history running the company."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says U.S. has 93 million people 'out of work,' but that's way too high
statement: "We have 93 million people out of work. They look for jobs, they give up, and all of a sudden, statistically, they're considered employed."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says U.S. is 'most highly taxed nation in the world'
statement: "We’re the most highly taxed nation in the world."

ruling_headline: Trump says U.S. companies 'moving into Mexico more than almost any other place right now'
statement: "Our companies are moving into Mexico more than almost any other place right now."

statement_context: a town hall in Derry, N.H.
ruling_headline: Trump: 'Many' scholars say 'anchor babies' aren't covered by Constitution
statement: "Many of the great scholars say that anchor babies are not covered" by the 14th Amendment.

ruling_headline: Trump says illegal immigrants get $4.2B in tax credits but doesn't count their taxes paid
statement: "The annual cost of free tax credits alone paid to illegal immigrants quadrupled to $4.2 billion in 2011."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump: Iran gets to keep $150 billion even if U.S. rejects nuclear deal
statement: Says "if the (Iran nuclear) deal gets rejected, they still get" $150 billion.

statement_context: an interview on CBS' "Face the Nation"
ruling_headline: Fact-checking Donald Trump's claim that 'every poll said I won the debate'
statement: "Every poll said I won the debate."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says 'he didn't say' the things about women that Megyn Kelly asked him about in debate
statement: "Some of the things that (Megyn Kelly) said, I didn’t say."

ruling_headline: Trump: Illegal immigration wasn't on anyone's mind before he entered the race
statement: Illegal immigration "wasn’t a subject that was on anybody’s mind until I brought it up at my announcement."

statement_context: comments at a GOP debate in Cleveland
ruling_headline: Donald Trump: 'The Mexican government ... they send the bad ones over'
statement: "The Mexican government ... they send the bad ones over."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump: Black income, unemployment 'worse now than just about ever'
statement: Under President Barack Obama, income levels and unemployment numbers "are worse now than just about ever" for African-Americans.

statement_context: a campaign rally in South Carolina
ruling_headline: Donald Trump: Guantanamo prisoners swapped for Bowe Bergdahl are 'back on the battlefield'
statement: The five Guantanamo detainees swapped for Bowe Bergdahl "are right now back on the battlefield."

ruling_headline: After 'not a war hero' remark, Donald Trump says John McCain has 'done nothing' for veterans
statement: Says John McCain "has done nothing to help the vets."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says if you're from Syria and a Christian, you can't come to the U.S. as a refugee
statement: "If you're from Syria and you're a Christian, you cannot come into this country" as a refugee.

ruling_headline: Trump: I called McCain a 'hero' four times
statement: "Four times, I said, he (John McCain) is a hero, but you know ... people choose selective pieces."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says the '$5 billion website for Obamacare … never worked. Still doesn't work'
statement: "The $5 billion website for Obamacare … never worked. Still doesn't work."

statement_context: an interview with NBC's Katy Tur
ruling_headline: Donald Trump says Mexican government 'forces many bad people into our country'
statement: "The Mexican government forces many bad people into our country."

statement_context: an interview on Fox Business Network
ruling_headline: Trump immigration claim has no data to back it up
statement: "Hundreds of thousands of (illegal immigrants are) going to state and federal penitentiaries."

ruling_headline: Is Donald Trump's 'Art of the Deal' the best-selling business book of all time?
statement: Says his book, The Art of the Deal, is "the No. 1 selling business book of all time."

statement_context: comments on CNN's "State of the Union"
ruling_headline: Trump: Pro-choice polling numbers declining
statement: Public support for abortion "is actually going down a little bit," polls show.

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says 'our nuclear arsenal doesn't work'
statement: "Even our nuclear arsenal doesn't work. It came out recently they have equipment that is 30 years old. They don't know if it worked."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump: Chevrolet in Tokyo, Japan, 'doesn't exist'
statement: "When was the last time you saw a Chevrolet in Japan? It doesn’t exist, folks."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says 'real' unemployment rate is 18 to 20 percent
statement: "Our real unemployment is anywhere from 18 to 20 percent. Don't believe the 5.6. Don't believe it."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump gets claim about U.S. GDP doubly wrong
statement: "The last quarter, it was just announced, our gross domestic product … was below zero. Who ever heard of this? It's never below zero."

statement_context: a speech announcing his 2016 presidential campaign
ruling_headline: Donald Trump: ISIS built a hotel in Syria
statement: The Islamic State "just built a hotel in Syria."

statement_context: the first presidential debate in Denver
ruling_headline: Barack Obama says 'Donald Trump is a small business' in debate
statement: "Under Gov. Romney's definition ... Donald Trump is a small business."

ruling_headline: Trump: U.S. doesn't build bridges anymore
statement: "We don't have bridges being built" in the United States.

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says Kuwait never paid U.S. back for ousting Saddam Hussein
statement: After the U.S.-led military alliance ejected Saddam Hussein’s forces from Kuwait in 1991, the Kuwaitis "never paid us."

ruling_headline: Trump says recent CNN poll shows him competitive in contest with Obama
statement: "CNN did a poll recently where Obama and I are statistically tied."

statement_context: an interview with Sean Hannity of Fox News
ruling_headline: Donald Trump says Iraq has the second-biggest oilfields in the world
statement: "Iraq has the second-largest oilfields in the world (behind) Saudi Arabia."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump claims Obama has spent $2 million in legal fees defending lawsuits about his birth certificate
statement: President Obama has spent over $2 million in legal fees defending lawsuits about his birth certificate.

ruling_headline: Libya sells most of its oil to Europe, not China
statement: "Libya supplies the oil for China. We get no oil from Libya."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says his show is No. 1 on NBC -- is he right?
statement: "I have the No. 1 show on NBC."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump Says President Obama's grandmother caught on tape saying she witnessed his birth in Kenya
statement: Says President Obama's "grandmother in Kenya said he was born in Kenya and she was there and witnessed the birth."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says South Korea doesn't pay United States for troop presence
statement: South Korea doesn't pay the United States for U.S. troops that protect their country.

statement_context: a speech at the CPAC conference
ruling_headline: Donald Trump says people who went to school with Obama never saw him
statement: "The people that went to school with (Barack Obama), they never saw him, they don't know who he is."
